question_content.barrons:question: In a sense, Constable’s art and politics were shaped by one dominant emotion: an abiding, even obsessive ________ the world of his rural childhood, the only world in which he probably felt at ease.
question_content.barrons:explanation:
attachment to; regard for.

If the world of Constable’s rural childhood was the only world in which he felt comfortable, then one could best describe the emotion he felt for it as an abiding attachment (devotion) or regard (esteem).

Divergence from is incorrect. Divergence (branching off or deviation) is not an emotion.

Ignorance of is incorrect. Ignorance is not an emotion.

Facility with is incorrect. Facility (ease due to skill or practice) is not an emotion.

Indifference to is incorrect. If the world of Constable’s rural childhood indeed was the only world in which he felt comfortable, then he would have cared about it; he would not have been indifferent to it.
